carousel_items: The shampoo is meant to be used once every 3 to 4 days, while the cream, gel and foam are meant to be used one to three times a day.
It can take at least 2 to 6 weeks for the infection to completely clear, and it can take 3 to 6 months before the skin returns to its original color for some infections.
Make sure Ketoconazole doesn't get into the eyes.
If you're using the foam, spray the foam into the cap, not your hands since it can melt before you put it on, and apply onto the skin, not the hair.
Can cause redness, swelling, and an irritated or burning sensation to the area where you put Ketoconazole on.

basics.benefits_moa: Ketoconazole is an antifungal medicine. It prevents yeast and fungi from reproducing and making their protective outer cell wall.
basics.bottom_line: Ketoconazole is a medication used on your skin to treat fungal infections; however, it takes several weeks for full recovery, and the directions are specific to each type of medication.
downsides: The foams (Extina and Ketodan) and gel (Xolegel) are only available as brand name and can be more expensive.
The 2.5% shampoo and creams are available only by prescription, but are generic.
The shampoo has to be left on for at least 5-10 minutes after lathering before you rinse it off.
It can take a few weeks for the infection to clear and a few months before the skin returns to its normal color.
The fungal infections can be confused for other skin infections, so if Ketoconazole doesn't work, it could be caused by another skin problem.

downsides_processed.orig: The foams (Extina and Ketodan) and gel (Xolegel) are only available as brand name and can be more expensive.
The 2.5% shampoo and creams are available only by prescription, but are generic.
The shampoo has to be left on for at least 5-10 minutes after lathering before you rinse it off.
It can take a few weeks for the infection to clear and a few months before the skin returns to its normal color.
The fungal infections can be confused for other skin infections, so if Ketoconazole doesn't work, it could be caused by another skin problem.

upsides: Recommended as a first choice medication to treat skin infections caused by fungi, including cradle cap, seborrheic dermatitis, and tinea versicolor.
Ketoconazole isn't taken orally, so it doesn't cause liver issues.
Can be used with other medications to help control redness and swelling.
The 1% shampoo is available over-the-counter in the drugstore.

upsides_processed.orig: Recommended as a first choice medication to treat skin infections caused by fungi, including cradle cap, seborrheic dermatitis, and tinea versicolor.
Ketoconazole isn't taken orally, so it doesn't cause liver issues.
Can be used with other medications to help control redness and swelling.
The 1% shampoo is available over-the-counter in the drugstore.

userStories.tip: works great on sebbhoreaic dermatitis on my face.  clears things up pretty much immediately

drugs.name: Ketoconazole

carousel_items_processed.orig: The shampoo is meant to be used once every 3 to 4 days, while the cream, gel and foam are meant to be used one to three times a day.
It can take at least 2 to 6 weeks for the infection to completely clear, and it can take 3 to 6 months before the skin returns to its original color for some infections.
Make sure Ketoconazole doesn't get into the eyes.
If you're using the foam, spray the foam into the cap, not your hands since it can melt before you put it on, and apply onto the skin, not the hair.
Can cause redness, swelling, and an irritated or burning sensation to the area where you put Ketoconazole on.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Ketoconazole can contain sodium sulfite anhydrous, a sulfite that can cause allergic-type reactions including severe asthmatic episodes in people with asthma.

description_processed.orig: Ketoconazole can contain sodium sulfite anhydrous, a sulfite that can cause allergic-type reactions including severe asthmatic episodes in people with asthma.

carousel_items: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

basics.benefits_moa: Metronidazole is an antibiotic that kills bacteria by cutting off their supply of energy and ruining their DNA.
basics.bottom_line: Metronidazole is a very good way to treat certain bacteria infections, but you can't have any alcohol while on it since it'll make you throw up. A lot.
downsides: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't drink alcohol while on this medication, and for at least 3 days after you finish Metronidazole.
If you're breastfeeding, you'll need to switch to a formula to feed your baby for at least 3 days after you finish taking Metronidazole.
Side effects include nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and headache.
Your urine can turn a dark red color while on Metronidazole.
The oral version of Flagyl 375 mg is only available as brand name so this particular form can be expensive.

upsides: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

upsides_processed.orig: Metronidazole is extremely effective in killing bacteria.
Unlike many other antibiotics, Metronidazole is less likely to make bacteria resistant to the medication.
Available in different forms including a topical (skin) version, a vaginal version, and multiple oral (by mouth) versions.
Most forms are available as a generic, so it is relatively cheap.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: If you are hypersensitive to medications (i.e., several drug allergies), PLEASE check with your medical professional for alternatives. Side effect (arthralgia - joint pain) are STILL present after 2.5 days of taking, 7 weeks later!
userStories.indication: Was given when PID was suspected (ended up not being)

drugs.name: Flagyl

labeled_indications.indication: Colorectal infection prevention after a surgery

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't drink any alcohol while on this (and don't even use mouthwash with alcohol in it) for at least 3 days after using Metronidazole since it can cause a serious reaction in your stomach and make you throw up.
Take this medication exactly as your doctor or pharmacist tells you. Don't stop taking it early, or the bacteria left in your body will become resistant to future antibiotics you'll take.
If you're taking the extended release (ER) form, take it 1 hour before or 2 hours after you eat.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mental status | Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had changes in their mental status or suffered nerve damage. This is rare, and usually goes away after Metronidazole is stopped. Call your doctor immediately if you suddenly feel confused, have trouble walking, feel dizzy, or feel numbness or tingling.

risks_warnings.title: Aseptic meningitis
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Metronidazole who have had aseptic meningitis, or an inflammation along the coverings of the brain. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you have a very painful headache, sensitivity to light, loss of appetite or vomiting once you start taking Metronidazole.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.

description_processed.orig: Clinical studies involving mice and rats have shown that exposure to Metronidazole can cause cancer in these animals. However, studies haven't shown that this is true in humans, but Metronidazole should only be given when your doctor thinks it's necessary.

carousel_items: It can take a few months for improvements to be seen, especially for finger and toenail infections.
You can be more likely to get a sunburn, so put on sunblock when you go outside.
If you're taking the oral granules, mix them in a spoonful of mashed potatoes or pudding, and then swallow it whole without chewing. Don't use fruit-based soft foods.
Your doctor will have you get regular blood work done to make sure Terbinafine isn't causing side effects.
If you forget your daily dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it's less than 4 hours to your next dose, then skip it. Don't take two doses at once.

basics.benefits_moa: Terbinafine is an antifungal medication that prevents the fungi from creating the protective layers it needs to survive. It treats scalp, toenail, and fingernail infections.
basics.bottom_line: Terbinafine has the highest cure rate of all antifungal medications, but you need to take it for a few weeks or months to see if it'll work for you.
downsides: It can take weeks to months to see any changes in the infection.
While Terbinafine has the highest cure rate of all antifungal medications, there's still a chance it may not work.
Can cause headache, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.

downsides_processed.orig: It can take weeks to months to see any changes in the infection.
While Terbinafine has the highest cure rate of all antifungal medications, there's still a chance it may not work.
Can cause headache, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.

upsides: Recommended as a first-choice treatment for fungal infections. It has a high cure rate and very few side effects.
Available as a generic medication, so it's cheap.
It's the only antifungal medication that is available in different oral forms and can be used by children.

upsides_processed.orig: Recommended as a first-choice treatment for fungal infections. It has a high cure rate and very few side effects.
Available as a generic medication, so it's cheap.
It's the only antifungal medication that is available in different oral forms and can be used by children.

drugs.name: Terbinafine

carousel_items_processed.orig: It can take a few months for improvements to be seen, especially for finger and toenail infections.
You can be more likely to get a sunburn, so put on sunblock when you go outside.
If you're taking the oral granules, mix them in a spoonful of mashed potatoes or pudding, and then swallow it whole without chewing. Don't use fruit-based soft foods.
Your doctor will have you get regular blood work done to make sure Terbinafine isn't causing side effects.
If you forget your daily dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it's less than 4 hours to your next dose, then skip it. Don't take two doses at once.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage in people taking Terbinafine. Your doctor will do some blood tests to make sure you don't have liver damage before taking this medication. Call your doctor immediately if you have pain in your abdomen, yellowing of the skin or whites of the eyes, have dark urine, or light colored stool. All of these can be signs of changes to your liver.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage in people taking Terbinafine. Your doctor will do some blood tests to make sure you don't have liver damage before taking this medication. Call your doctor immediately if you have pain in your abdomen, yellowing of the skin or whites of the eyes, have dark urine, or light colored stool. All of these can be signs of changes to your liver.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in taste and smell
risks_warnings.description: People taking Terbinafine have reported changes in the way food tastes and how things smell. This can be permanent if the medication's not stopped in time, but this is also very rare.

description_processed.orig: People taking Terbinafine have reported changes in the way food tastes and how things smell. This can be permanent if the medication's not stopped in time, but this is also very rare.

risks_warnings.title: Depression
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people becoming depressed while taking Terbinafine, but this is very rare.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people becoming depressed while taking Terbinafine, but this is very rare.

risks_warnings.title: Skin rash
risks_warnings.description: Some people get serious skin rashes while taking Terbinafine. Call your doctor immediately if you develop a high fever and a sudden blistering rash.

description_processed.orig: Some people get serious skin rashes while taking Terbinafine. Call your doctor immediately if you develop a high fever and a sudden blistering rash.

risks_warnings.title: Lupus
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people who've either started getting symptoms of lupus or had worsening symptoms while taking Terbinafine. Talk to your doctor if you've had lupus and they're considering starting you on Terbinafine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people who've either started getting symptoms of lupus or had worsening symptoms while taking Terbinafine. Talk to your doctor if you've had lupus and they're considering starting you on Terbinafine.
